docs/graph-data.json has uncommitted changes. If the graph

the synced graph data.

This ensures GitHub Pages always has current decision graph data.

message:
refactor: TEA architecture for TUI with functional core

- Add src/tui/state.rs: pure state transformations (14 tests)
  - Navigation: move_selection_up/down, page_up/down, clamp_selection
  - Filtering: filter_by_type/branch/search, apply_all_filters

  - Branch/type cycling helpers

- Add src/tui/msg.rs: message types for all user actions (8 tests)
  - Msg enum covering navigation, views, filters, modals, actions
  - ViewKind enum with next/prev cycling
  - key_to_msg pure function for input handling
  - Helper predicates: is_quit, is_navigation, is_filter_change

- Add src/tui/update.rs: pure update function (19 tests)
  - TEA-style update: Msg -> Model -> (Model, Cmd)
  - Cmd enum for side effects (Quit, ReloadGraph, OpenFiles, etc.)
  - Model struct mirroring essential App state
  - All state transitions are pure and testable

- Fix export.rs: replace 47 writeln!().unwrap() with w!/wln! macros
  - Writing to String never fails, but write! returns Result
  - New macros make intent explicit and remove panic risk

Test count: 24 -> 65 (+41 new tests)

author: Bobby Nathan
message:
fix: Unicode-safe truncation and patch export edge filtering

- Fix truncate functions to use char-based indexing instead of bytes
  Prevents panic on multi-byte UTF-8 chars (emoji, checkmarks, etc.)
  Fixed in: tui/types.rs, timeline.rs, export.rs, main.rs

- Fix patch export: edges now only included when BOTH endpoints in patch
  Previously used OR logic which caused "missing node" errors on apply

- Add `deciduous diff validate` command to pre-check patches
  Reports edges with missing node references before applying

- Add Live Graph Diff Viewer and Live Graph Editor to roadmap

author: Bobby Nathan
message:
feat: add multi-user graph sync with diff/patch model

jj-inspired design for syncing decision graphs across multiple users:

Schema changes:
- Add change_id (UUID) column to decision_nodes for stable cross-db references
- Add from_change_id/to_change_id columns to decision_edges
- Auto-migration on database open for existing databases

New commands:
- deciduous diff export: Export nodes as JSON patch files
- deciduous diff apply: Apply patches to local database (idempotent)
- deciduous diff status: List patches in directory
- deciduous migrate: Manually run database migration

Patch format (JSON):
- version, author, branch, created_at, base_commit metadata
- nodes array with change_id, type, title, metadata
- edges array with from/to change_ids, edge_type, rationale

Workflow:
1. User creates nodes locally
2. Export: deciduous diff export --nodes 1-10 -o patches/feature.json
3. Commit patch file to git
4. Others pull and apply: deciduous diff apply patches/feature.json
5. Idempotent - same patch can be applied multiple times safely

See docs/MULTI_USER_SYNC.md for full design documentation.

Add editor-specific initialization support:

- `deciduous init --claude` (default): Creates .claude/commands/ with

  to CLAUDE.md

- `deciduous init --windsurf`: Creates .windsurf/rules/ with
  decision.md and context.md rules, appends workflow section to
  AGENTS.md

Both editors share the same .deciduous/ database and docs/ for GitHub
Pages.

Flags are mutually exclusive via Clap argument groups.

Also adds ROADMAP.md with backlog items for legacy cleanup.

author: Bobby Nathan
message:
Add React+TypeScript+Vite unified graph viewer (Phase A of Deciduous)

This is Phase A of extracting the decision graph tooling into a standalone
package called "deciduous". This commit adds a modern React web viewer that
combines all 4 existing graph views into a single tabbed interface.

## Decision Context (from graph nodes 99-107)

**Goal (node 99)**: Create Deciduous - extract decision graph tooling into
a standalone portable package that can be used in any project.

**Key Decision (node 101)**: Web viewer architecture
- Evaluated two options:
  - Option A (node 102): Vanilla JS + D3 - no build step, embed in binary
  - Option B (node 103): React + TypeScript + Vite - modern DX, type safety
- **Chose Option B** because TypeScript types can mirror Diesel ORM exactly,
  providing compile-time guarantees that frontend matches backend schemas.

**Decision (node 100)**: Include full Claude tooling in deciduous init
- Slash commands, CLAUDE.md workflow section, Makefile shortcuts
- This ensures projects using deciduous get the full decision-tracking workflow

## What's New

### web/ - React + TypeScript + Vite Application
- **4 Views Combined**: Chains, Timeline, Graph (D3 force), DAG (Dagre)
- **TypeScript Types**: Mirror Diesel ORM exactly (DecisionNode, DecisionEdge)
- **Shared Components**: Layout, DetailPanel, NodeBadge, TypeFilters
- **Graph Processing**: BFS chain building, session grouping, path tracing
- **Build**: Vite with React plugin, production bundle ~365KB

### Types Matching Diesel ORM
```typescript
// These match src/db.rs Diesel models exactly
type NodeType = 'goal' | 'decision' | 'option' | 'action' | 'outcome' | 'observation';
type NodeStatus = 'pending' | 'active' | 'completed' | 'rejected';
type EdgeType = 'leads_to' | 'requires' | 'chosen' | 'rejected' | 'blocks' | 'enables';
```

### Makefile Additions
- `make web` - Sync graph data and start dev server
- `make web-dev` - Start development server (http://localhost:3001)
- `make web-build` - Build production bundle
- `make web-typecheck` - Run TypeScript type checking
- `make web-sync` - Sync graph data to web/public/

### README Updates
- Documented web viewer commands
- Added note: Makefile is the primary entrypoint for Claude skills

## Files Added
- web/.gitignore - Excludes node_modules, dist, .vite
- web/package.json, tsconfig.json, vite.config.ts
- web/src/types/graph.ts - TypeScript types matching Diesel
- web/src/views/{ChainsView,TimelineView,GraphView,DagView}.tsx
- web/src/components/{Layout,DetailPanel,NodeBadge,TypeFilters}.tsx
- web/src/hooks/{useGraphData,useChains}.ts
- web/src/utils/{graphProcessing,colors}.ts

## Next Steps (Phases B-G)
- Phase B: Fork losselot to deciduous repository
- Phase C: Remove audio/WASM code, keep decision graph
- Phase D: Restructure CLI for deciduous commands
- Phase E: Add live viewing with file watcher and SSE
- Phase F: Implement deciduous init with Claude tooling
- Phase G: Create documentation site (GitHub Pages)

author: Bobby Nathan
message:
Fix spectrogram not rendering - canvas needs visible parent

Charts were being drawn before result div was made visible.
Canvas getBoundingClientRect() returned 0 when parent is display:none.
Fix: show result first, then use requestAnimationFrame to draw charts.

author: Bobby Grayson
message:
feat: GitHub Pages living museum site (#14)

* feat: Add GitHub Pages living museum site

A documentation site showcasing both the audio forensics tools and the
AI-assisted development methodology used to build this project.

Site structure:
- Landing page with quick start and four pillars overview
- Audio Analysis: CFCC, spectral analysis, detection explained
- Decision Graph: Tour of the real graph with screenshots
- Claude Tooling: Slash commands, context recovery, session continuity
- Development Story: Timeline, what didn't work, lessons learned

Demo includes:
- Real losselot.db with 17 nodes from actual development
- Interactive graph viewer loading real decision data
- Screenshots of the graph UI in action

The decision graph documents real choices made during development,
including the lo-fi detection algorithm decision (CFCC vs temporal
variance) and the site structure decision itself.

* feat: Add client-side WASM analyzer

Pure Rust FFT analysis compiled to WebAssembly - no JS fallback.
Runs the same 8192-sample windowed analysis as CLI: CFCC cliff
detection, cutoff variance, rolloff slope, ultrasonic energy.

- wasm-analyzer/: Rust crate with rustfft, wasm-bindgen
- docs/analyzer.html: Drag-drop UI, Web Audio API decoding
- GitHub Actions workflow builds WASM on deploy

author: Bobby Nathan
message: Add direct download links at top of README
